Redhat Enterprise Linux 5.1 is a obviously not free. However, there are several distributions you can use for personal use, server, or even for public usage. Like Scientific Linux, centOS, and Fedora. The above mentioned use the RPM, and YUM package managers, for those who are not familiar with Linux, I suggest you go to these pages, and read the documentations first.

https://www.scientificlinux.org/
http://www.centos.org/
http://fedoraproject.org/
http://www.ubuntu.com/

NOTE: Ubuntu is based on debian, which is probably the easiest distribution out there. It's perfect for beginners, to get familiar and the sense of how Linux works, than you can move to a more technical release if you like it. Since in Linux things are not going to be done for you, unlike with Windows, or Mac. Ubuntu is very popular for that, and it has good documentation.
